intro: Dryandra pulchella, commonly known as the pink dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves and produces woody fruits that split open to release seeds. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the region's dry climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
